About

I'm currently an Associate Professor at Paris Cité University, affiliated with the BioSTM Lab and Paris Faculty of Pharmacy. My research seeks to build machine learning models capable of approaching the performance of humain brain in terms of flexibility to changes in environments and tasks.

Leveraging Optimal Transport Theory, I study methods for Domain Adaptation and Transfer Learning. Optimal transport offers powerful geometrical tools that enable me to model tasks, compute solutions and provide theoretical guarantees for algorithms. In the past, I have worked on semi-supervised learning and various aspects of distributed unsupervised learning.

Before my current position, I held the role of Assistant Professor at Sorbonne Paris Nord University. Prior to that, I obtained a Ph.D. and a Master's degree in Computer Science from Sorbonne Paris Nord University. Additionally, I possess Master's and Bachelor's degrees in Applied Mathematics from Fez Faculty of Science.

Teaching

To teach is to learn twice over

- Joseph Joubert

I mostly teach statistics and machine learning at Paris Cité University.

Among others, I have TA'd the following courses at Sorbonne Paris Nord University:

  • Master 2 EID2 and Master 2 MMD: Deep Learning
  • Master 2 EID2 and Master 2 MMD: Statistical learning
  • Master 2 EID2 and Master 2 MMD: Data Science
  • Master 2 EID2 and Master 2 MMD: Multidimensional Exploratory Statistics
  • Master 1 Informatique: Matrix Methods in Data Mining
  • Licence 3: Databases
  • Licence 3: Data Visualisation
  • Licence 1: UNIX Environment
  • Licence 1: Numerical Linear Algebra
  • Licence 1: C Programming Language
  • Licence 1: Imperative Programming
  • Cycle d'ing 1: Algorithms
  • Cycle d'ing 1: MATLAB
  • Cycle d'ing 1: Python

Advising

    I was in charge in 2021 and 2022 of the co-supervision of two MSc students as part of the Erasmus+ Mobility Program:

  • Hamid AHAGGACH, Master's thesis. Now a PhD student at Bourgogne University.
  • Omar Ghannou, Master's thesis. Now a PhD student at Aix-Marseille University.

Academic Genealogy

My academic genealogy (adviser relations) backs to 17 generations over 370 years, in the following reverse chronological order:

    • Mourad El Hamri
      Structural Optimal Transport for Domain Adaptation with Theoretical Guarantees
      Université Sorbonne Paris Nord - 2022
    • Younès Bennani
      Approches connexionnistes pour la reconnaissance du locuteur: modélisation et identification
      Université Paris-Sud - 1992
    • Françoise Fogelman-Soulié
      Contributions à une théorie du calcul sur réseaux
      Université Joseph-Fourier - 1985
    • François Robert
      Étude et utilisation de normes vectorielles en analyse numérique linéaire
      Université Joseph-Fourier - 1968
    • Noël Gastinel
      Matrices du second degré et normes générales en analyse numérique linéaire
      Université Joseph-Fourier - 1960
    • Jean Kuntzmann
      Contribution à l'étude des systèmes multiformes
      Université de Paris - 1940
    • Georges Valiron
      Sur les fonctions entières d'ordre nul et d'ordre fini et en particulier les fonctions à correspondance régulière
      Université de Paris - 1914
